content: I want to apply for a savings account

Since youâ€™re looking for the easiest way to start, Iâ€™d recommend #SaveUp or #MySaveUp. Both are 100 % digitalâ€”open in under 5 minutes through the BPI Mobile app with just Php 1 initial deposit and zero maintaining balance. Once you keep Php 5,000 in the account, youâ€™ll earn 0.0925 % p.a. interest. Great if you plan to bank mostly on your phone.

response.message: I want to apply for a savings account
response.translated_message:
Here is the translation:

"I would like to open a savings account."

(Note: "apply" is not the most common way to express this idea in English, especially in a banking context. "Open" or "apply for" are more common ways to express this idea.)

suggestions.suggestion: Since youâ€™re looking for the easiest way to start, Iâ€™d recommend #SaveUp or #MySaveUp. Both are 100 % digitalâ€”open in under 5 minutes through the BPI Mobile app with just Php 1 initial deposit and zero maintaining balance. Once you keep Php 5,000 in the account, youâ€™ll earn 0.0925 % p.a. interest. Great if you plan to bank mostly on your phone.

If youâ€™d like a passbook for kids or teens, Jumpstart Savings is perfect: Php 100 to open, Php 1,000 monthly average daily balance (ADB), and the Php 1,000 maintaining balance is waived for the first year. Interest of 0.0625 % p.a. starts once the daily balance hits Php 2,000.

Saver-Plus offers tiered interest up to 0.0625 % p.a., but youâ€™ll need Php 50,000 daily balance to earn the top rate. If you can keep at least Php 3,000 to open and Php 50,000 day-to-day, this account gives you higher returns than Regular Savings.

Regular Savings is the classic passbook account: Php 3,000 to open, Php 3,000 monthly ADB, and Php 5,000 daily balance to earn 0.0625 % p.a. Choose this if you prefer face-to-face service at branches and donâ€™t mind the higher maintaining balance.

For OFWs or relatives receiving remittances, Pamana Savings (US Dollar) is ideal. Open with USD 500, keep USD 1,000 daily balance to earn 0.050 % p.a., and enjoy free life insurance worth 3Ã— your average balance (up to USD 40,000). If you receive US pension credits, the Direct Deposit US Pension account is another option with only USD 100 to open.

Once your daily balance hits Php 5,000, youâ€™ll earn 0.0925 % p.a. interestâ€”perfect for starting small and growing your savings entirely on your phone.

response.translated_message:
Here is the translation:

"I would like to open a savings account."

(Note: In Tagalog, "apply" is often used to mean "to open" or "to start", so the translation is adjusted to convey the correct meaning in the context of banking.)

suggestions.suggestion: Since youâ€™re all about digital convenience, #SaveUp is your best bet. Open it in the BPI Mobile app in under 5 minutes with just Php 1 initial deposit and zero maintaining balance. Once your daily balance hits Php 5,000, youâ€™ll earn 0.0925 % p.a. interestâ€”perfect for starting small and growing your savings entirely on your phone.

If youâ€™d like a passbook option for kids or teens, Jumpstart Savings is great: Php 100 to open, Php 1,000 monthly ADB (waived the first year), and 0.0625 % p.a. interest once you keep Php 2,000 daily. For adults who prefer a traditional passbook, Regular Savings needs Php 3,000 to open and the same amount as maintaining balance, earning 0.0625 % p.a. at Php 5,000 daily balance.

For #SaveUp or #MySaveUp, you only need one valid government ID and your mobile number for OTPâ€”no income docs required. Everything is verified digitally. If you later choose Regular Savings or Saver-Plus, bring the same ID plus Php 3,000 (Regular) or Php 50,000 (Saver-Plus) initial deposit.

#SaveUp/#MySaveUp: 0.0925 % p.a. at Php 5,000 daily balance. Jumpstart: 0.0625 % p.a. at Php 2,000 daily. Regular Savings: 0.0625 % p.a. at Php 5,000 daily. Saver-Plus: 0.125 % p.a. but requires Php 50,000 daily balanceâ€”ideal when youâ€™re ready to keep larger amounts.

#SaveUp and #MySaveUp are fully digitalâ€”no passbook, no branch visits. Jumpstart, Regular Savings, and Saver-Plus support online fund transfers and mobile check deposits, but you may need to visit a branch for passbook updates or large cash deposits. Stick with #SaveUp if you want everything done on your phone.
